description: Stephens Coyote Ridge Regional Park contains 102 hectares of beautiful natural area including ponds and grasslands. It is largely untouched by weeds and is pristine habitat for wildlife, including coyotes who live in the park as the name suggests.There are hiking trails and wetlands available in the park.  Dogs on leash are allowed on trails in this park.  The park is open daylight hours year-round. Park Map: http://www.regionaldistrict.com/docs/parks/TrailMaps/CoyoteRidgeMap.pdfGPS shows the main trail up and along the ridge, there are several other trails that go to small lakes within the park (not shown on GPS map)
directions: The access is located along north Glenmore Road between Kelowna and Lake Country.  Parking is located at the North parking area for the dog park.
title: Stephens Coyote Ridge
